### **Nervecentre**

**Module:** Laboratory Alerting & Medicines Safety
**Event Type:** *Critical Medicine-Related LFT Alert – Methotrexate Patient*

---

## **1. Alert Event Summary**

* **System Alert ID:** NC-LFT-20240814-003
* **Patient:** Sarah Miller (MRN: SM43850603, DOB: 1981-06-03, 43F)
* **Linked Encounter:**

  * Visit Type: Outpatient – Rheumatology Review
  * Date & Time: **2024-08-14 @ 14:32**
  * Clinician: **Dr. R. Hall (Rheumatology Registrar)**
* **Ordering Provider:** Dr. R. Hall
* **Requesting Location:** Rheumatology Clinic – Room 5

---

## **2. Trigger Details**

* **Trigger Rule:**

  * **Rule 4.5 – ALT ≥ 3 × ULN OR ALT ≥ 2 × ULN in patients on hepatotoxic drugs (MTX).**

* **Analyte Triggering Alert:**

  * **ALT: 158 U/L** (ULN 40 U/L → **3.95 × ULN**)

* **Associated LFTs:**

  * AST: 132 U/L (H)
  * ALP: 118 U/L (N)
  * Total Bilirubin: 17 μmol/L (N)
  * Direct Bilirubin: 4 μmol/L (N)
  * INR: 1.1 (N)
  * Platelets: 238 × 10⁹/L (N)

* **Pattern of Injury:**

  * **Hepatocellular**, ALT > AST > 3× ULN, normal bilirubin

* **Alert Level:** **Level 3 – *Critical hepatotoxicity (MTX patient)***

* **Severity Banding:**

  * MTX patient with ALT >3× ULN → **“Immediate clinical review required”**

* **Medication Linkage:**

  * Methotrexate 15mg weekly (started ~12 weeks prior)
  * Folic acid 5mg weekly

---

## **3. Distribution & Delivery Log**

**Primary Recipients:**

* Dr. R. Hall (Ordering clinician)
* Rheumatology Consultant On-Call
* GP (auto-copied for medicine safety review)

**Secondary Recipients:**

* Pharmacy / DMARD Safety Team (Queue: *DMARD-SAFETY-PRIORITY*)
* Nervecentre Medicines Safety Dashboard

**Delivery Channels:**

* Nervecentre mobile push
* Desktop inbox message
* Email notification to Rheumatology duty mailbox (policy-mandated for Level 3 alerts)

**Delivery Timeline:**

1. **2024-08-14 14:33:10** – LFTs verified by lab
2. **2024-08-14 14:33:16** – Rule 4.5 fired (ALT 158)
3. **2024-08-14 14:33:20** – High-priority alert created
4. **2024-08-14 14:33:25** – Push & desktop alerts sent to Rheumatology
5. **2024-08-14 14:33:28** – Medicines Safety Dashboard updated (red flag)

Current status: **Alert acknowledged by Dr. Hall at 14:41**
Escalation aborted (acknowledged in time)

---

## **4. Acknowledgment & Escalation Logic**

* **Acknowledgement Requirement:**

  * Level 3 alerts require action **within 2 hours**.

* **Acknowledgement Status:**

  * **Acknowledged – Dr. Hall at 14:41**
  * Comment: “MTX held. Repeat LFTs in 48h. Arrange fibrosis screen & ultrasound.”

* **Escalation Path (not triggered):**

  * Rheumatology Consultant (15 min delay)
  * Duty Manager (if >2h unacknowledged)
  * Pharmacy DMARD team (parallel escalation)

---

## **5. Linked Tasks (Automatic)**

### **1. NC-TASK-20240814-MTX-HOLD**

* **Title:** “Suspend Methotrexate pending repeat LFTs”
* **Owner:** Dr. R. Hall
* **Due:** Immediate
* **Status:** **Completed (14:42)**
* **Notes:** MTX paused; patient notified.

---

### **2. NC-TASK-20240814-LFT-REPEAT48H**

* **Title:** “Repeat LFT panel in 48 hours (MTX hepatotoxicity)”
* **Owner:** Phlebotomy Hub (*Priority*)
* **Due:** 2024-08-16 @ 09:00
* **Status:** Open

---

### **3. NC-TASK-20240814-CLD-SCREEN**

* **Title:** “Non-invasive liver disease screen (MASLD, viral, autoimmune)”
* **Owner:** GP Practice (Liver Screening Queue)
* **Due:** 2024-08-21
* **Status:** Open

---

## **6. Safety & Governance Notes**

* **Policy Applied:**

  * NHS DMARD Safety Monitoring – “Stop MTX if ALT > 3× ULN.”
  * Local Hepatotoxicity Protocol v5.2

* **System Safety Comments:**

  * “High probability of MTX-related transaminitis; ensure follow-up imaging & screen.”
  * “No synthetic dysfunction (INR normal). No bilirubin rise. No acute liver failure features.”

* **Audit Trail (Extract):**

  * 14:33 – Alert created
  * 14:33 – Notifications dispatched
  * 14:41 – Acknowledged (Hall_R)
  * 14:42 – Action documented: MTX held

---

## **7. Impact on Medicines Dashboard**

* MTX moved to “**Withheld – Abnormal LFT**”
* Next review set: **2024-08-16 (await repeat LFTs)**
* Risk Score updated → **High**
